o:1.title: mod.io mods
o:1.description: tries to include as many mods as possible.

o:2.title: Asset Store Avatars
o:2.author: Mazladore
o:2.description:
Includes 6 avatars: Piggo, Astronaut, Cosmonaut, Blacksmith, Diver, and Gargolor.  Some more cursed than others.  Piggo recommended arm locomotion

To install:

Unzip the archive into your Bonelab Mods folder:

  • PC: C:\Users\[username]\AppData\LocalLow\Stress Level Zero\BONELAB\MODS
  • If installing locally to Quest 2, connect the headset with a Link cable, Allow Files from the connected device when prompted in the headset, then on the PC, navigate to:
    This PC\Quest 2\Internal shared storage\Android\data\com.StressLevelZero.BONELAB\files\Mods

o:47.title: Juno
o:47.author: RedSnow
o:47.description:
How to install it:

  • For PC: Install the Windows version of the mod, Extract the file from the zip and put the extracted file in the bonelab mods folder.
    The default location of the mods folder is C:\Users\[username]\AppData\LocalLow\Stress Level Zero\BONELAB\MODS.

  • For Quest, Install the Quest version of the mod and extract the file from the zip.
    Connect your vr headset with a Link cable, Allow Files from the connected device when prompted in the headset,
    then on the PC, navigate to:This PC\Quest 2\Internal shared storage\Android\data\com.StressLevelZero.BONELAB\files\Modsand move the previously extracted file into the mods folder.

o:50.title: Waluigi Avatar
o:50.author: TheCatin
o:50.description:
Nintendo's Waluigi as a bonelab avatar. I wanted to look at something... less distracting while playing as a fast character, lo and behold a character even hotter!
     Some adjustments had to be made for him to be as fast if not faster than the ninja girl, I had to bring his legs even higher, and make him dummy thicc, as well as thinning out the arms, I swear it was necessary. His chest is smaller and higher up than your irl chest, so it may take a second to get used to him.
 - The brim of the hat is visible, this is intentional
 - sfx coming soon™️

o:53.title: Cyberpunk Characters
o:53.author: SERVPH
o:53.description:
How to install. 

PC - Open the zip, and put the mod in this directory. "C:\Users\YOURNAMEHERE\AppData\LocalLow\Stress Level Zero\BONELAB\Mods"

Quest - Plug your quest into your PC and find the BoneLabs folder. Then goto the mods folder and put the mod into the folder :)

o:59.title: Puppies avatars

o:59.description: I am attempting to make the best working anime character that doesn't have broken hands. This should work other than the small spike due to weight painting issue, but I will fix it soon shes fast and basicasically works as a ninja type class that will get you around quickly but can't take a punch well.

o:65.title: Javelin partan
o:65.author: Chii'kyi
o:65.description:
The Javelin Spartan is an experimental design aimed at high-speed combat. 

She is crazy fast as you can see, decently strong as well. I hope you enjoy it! 

If you need help with anything my discord is: Chii'kyi#0001


///web.archive.org/web/20221002144647/https://due to the way Bonelab does not like abnormally long legs the feet clip in the ground a bit. I am trying to resolve this but it can take a bit///


PC ONLY (currently)


INSTALLATION

Extract the .ZIP file, copy the folder within into your Bonelab Mods folder.

  • The PC default is C:\Users\[username]\AppData\LocalLow\Stress Level Zero\BONELAB\MODS

o:70.title: John Wick
o:70.author: JassnSenvixe
o:70.description:
John Wick

__________________________________


Avatar/Playermodel made by Jass (me)

Model made by Senvixe (He merged Johnny Silverhand and Hitman 2 models)

Currently PCVR only

Now for Quest 2 as well, haven't tested though, so if it works tell me in the comments

__________________________________

HOW TO DOWNLOAD:

1. Open the Version x.0.0 on the right of your screen, (click the arrow)

2. Click on the file



HOW TO INSTALL: (copied from svindl1r's github)

  1. UNZIP or take the folder OUT OF THE ZIP
  2. Copy folder named xxxx.xxxx (x should be the name)
  3. WINDOWS + R
  4. Type Appdata and click enter
  5. LocalLow > Stress Level Zero > BONELAB > Mods
  6. Paste xxxx.xxxx into mods folder

 

  • If installing locally to Quest 2, connect the headset with a Link cable, Allow Files from the connected device when prompted in the headset, then on the PC, navigate to:This PC\Quest 2\Internal shared storage\Android\data\com.StressLevelZero.BONELAB\files\Mods and copy the mod folder from the zip to it.

check tha brotha out https://www.youtube.com/c/Senvixe

o:85.author: Chrom
o:85.description: Uh hey i make stromtrooper go BRRRRR

o:88.title: Clonetrooper
o:88.author: GrandAdmiralWrath
o:88.description:
The Clones have invaded the Void!!! Now you can live your fantasies as fighting against Nullbodies and attacking an army of Fords as a Clone Trooper! *Or at least a Coruscant Guard, as its the only one so far* 

 

Known Issues:

- Wrists can act funny when holding certain objects in certain ways, such as aiming with pistols. However it hasn't effected my aiming so haven't been focused on finding a fix.

- The Preview mesh when viewed from the Avatar Rope on the elbow shows another body to where his head should be, although the avatar looks just as you would expect while in game. Haven't figured out what could be causing that issue though, so let me know if you run across a fix :)

 

 

Model found from Sketchfab here.

o:90.title: gm_construct
o:90.author: Cyborin
o:90.description:
Secret room is enter-able, outdoors ambient loop is here, and lots of sandbox gadgets are at spawn!

In the future I would like to add proper ambient loops to their respective areas! As of now I'd say this map is pretty close to being finished but please let me know if you have any issues!

I may also port other source maps but these mods are made entirely for my own enjoyment so I cant guarantee anything.

 

Both downloads include a (pc) and (quest) level. The difference is that one lacks a skybox mesh in order to try optimizing for quest.

If the file is too large you can download 0.1 as that version doesnt include a shadowmap.

o:93.title: Steel N Gold
o:93.author: vrclassic
o:93.description:
warning super loud audio when loading sorry i'm working on it


HOW TO GET SPAWNER GUN AND FLYING THINGY IN THIS MAP

In the mod menu settings tab enable dev mode

There should be a beta mode option somewhere in the settings now I FORGOT WHERE

After this you should see a beta icon at the top right in the main menu

To the right of the crane controls in the bonelabs hub you will see a capsule for the spawner gun now

After opening this capsule and loading a new level you will now have an extra dev tools button in all levels

A VRChat classic. A team of bandits work to open safes, stealing three pieces of gold for their home safe. A team of sheriffs need to stop them by any means necessary. Use guns, bombs, ladders, windows, and nooses to get the win!
super early development and only is the map in the future the game will be fully playable


vrchat world: https://vrchat.com/home/world/wrld_07c65a5c-7483-449f-9a8c-666b77095553

trailer based from vrchat : https://youtu.be/kWJkk3m4bW4

join the discord : https://discord.gg/TAMpCN5k

o:134.title: Mario Kart
o:134.author: Fersy
o:134.description:
Map info:

This map is pretty bare bones right now, it has a audio source with the iconic theme, reverb zone fitting the map and a custom made skybox with 3d clouds and sun.

Gameplay Demonstration of the Map


I haven't tested this on the Quest 2 but it should work, let me know if it doesn't. Discord: Fersy#2002


# Installation for PC
0. UNZIP or take the folder OUT OF THE ZIP
1. Copy folder named xxxx.xxxx (x should be the name)
2. WINDOWS + R 
3. Type Appdata and click enter
4. LocalLow > Stress Level Zero > BONELAB > Mods
5. Paste xxxx.xxxx into mods folder

# Installation for QUEST
0. UNZIP or take the folder OUT OF THE ZIP
1. connect the headset with a Link cable
2. Allow Files from the connected device when prompted in the headset
3. then on the PC, navigate to: This PC\Quest 2\Internal shared storage\Android\data\com.StressLevelZero.BONELAB\files\Mods 
4. copy the folder to it

 

HOW TO GET SPAWNER GUN AND FLYING THINGY IN THIS MAP

  • In the mod menu settings tab enable dev mode
  • There should be a beta mode option somewhere in the settings now I FORGOT WHERE
  • After this you should see a beta icon at the top right in the main menu
  • To the right of the crane controls in the bonelabs hub you will see a capsule for the spawner gun now
  • After opening this capsule and loading a new level you will now have an extra dev tools button in all levels

o:137.title: Avatar
o:137.author: Timtam
o:137.description: Includes the hulk, Buff winnie the poo, some mutant guy from mixamo, a zombie, giant avatar from mixamo, there might be more I don't remember

o:144.title: Meow Skulls
o:144.author: skalx & TeCup
o:144.description:
Huge thanks to @PrincessTe_TV on twitter for helping fixing the rig's hands!)

 

Meow Skulls from Fortnite with the model and character ripped from it

 

INSTALL LOCATION

  • QUEST MODS FOLDER: This PC\Quest 2\Internal shared storage\Android\data\com.StressLevelZero.BONELAB\files\Mods
  • PC MODS FOLDER: C:\Users\[username]\AppData\LocalLow\Stress Level Zero\BONELAB\MODS

Make sure if you are installing manually that you are extracting the folder and not putting the zip files inside your mods folder

MAKE SURE YOU ARE ON THE NEW WEBSITE AND THAT YOU ARE SELECTING THE VERSION ACCORDING TO YOUR PLATFORM, Android for Quest, Windows for PC

If you are encountering any issues while installing or have any questions please do not hesitate to message me at skalx#1986 on discord

o:149.title: Combine_Grunt
o:149.author: JLM
o:149.description:
How to install it:

  • For PC:  Download the 'Windows' version, extract the zip file, Put the folder in the bonelab mods folder.
    The default location of the mods folder is C:\Users\[username]\AppData\LocalLow\Stress Level Zero\BONELAB\MODS.

  • For Quest: Download the 'Android' version, extract the zip file.
    Connect your vr headset with a Link cable, Allow Files from the connected device when prompted in the headset,
    then on the PC, navigate to:This PC\Quest 2\Internal shared storage\Android\data\com.StressLevelZero.BONELAB\files\Modsand move the extracted folder here.

o:157.title: Adam Smasher
o:157.author: Baphoma
o:157.description:
Adam Smasher! Night City Legend and a bleak mf one at that! This model has been heavily optimized to ensure good fps while playing. Two versions of the model will appear, quiet is a standard model, while chatty will yell 1 of 12 catchphrases and threats. It can be buggy if you take a bunch of damage at one.


Quest version in beta



Extract here C:\Users\(Your user Name)\AppData\LocalLow\Stress Level Zero\BONELAB\Mods

o:167.title: My Pallet
o:167.author: Author
o:167.description: This mod will give you access to the Gorilla Tag map. It is an awesome map that is great to play on. You will have a lot of fun playing on this map. There are many different areas to explore and many different challenges to complete. This mod is good

o:170.title: Male 07
o:170.author: Hate
o:170.description:
its the famous male 07 from the hit game Garry's mod and used a lot on a couple cool mods like half life 2 and its companying episodes.

famous for its very distinct face and other things.


He is scale accurate from hl2 so about 6 foot 3 inches.


INSTALL:

press win+r to open run and put in "%appdata%" and once the file is open back out once and open locallow

find Stresslevelzero > BONELAB > Mods and place the folder in the folder

*I haven't tested the site yet so if it downloads the zip folder you have to unzip it into the mods folder*


Credits:

my main man bbatmanso5 for sharing links and helpful recourses.

My other main man 16-bit aka toy818 for the photos you see of the PM as I was a work when making the post.

and the discord server you find at the end of the game.

o:172.title: The Compass
o:172.author: Kirtide
o:172.description:
Just a quick n small map I migrated over from my other Unity projects. I'm still getting used to the whole Unity URP thing, some things might look off like the particles, still tryna figure that out.

 

Also the particles might lag (small/tiny/idk) on some setups, sorry bout that (not really)

 

Expect (probably) updates lator on!

 

Original "The Compass" (link)

o:176.title: Birthday Boy Blam
o:176.author: Artsmen
o:176.description: WORKS ON QUEST, UNTESTED ON PC. This was one of the first avatars I made. The avatar ball is a little hard to reach on this but it's not impossible, Also it will lag a tiny bit when you change into him (atleast on quest) but the game will proceed to run normally after the particles disappear (I assume since he's so little his view is a bit bigger, meaning more particles can render in the view causing lag).

o:189.title: gru
o:189.author: Fredwheatfill
o:189.description: "Felonius Gru (or simply Gru) is the son of Marlena Gru and the late Robert Gru, and is the main protagonist of the Despicable Me franchise. He is a former supervillain and is the husband of AVL agent Lucy Wilde. He has three adopted daughters Margo, Edith, and Agnes. Gru is also the leader of the Minions, is friends with Dr. Nefario and is also the twin brother of Dru Gru." - Despicable Me fandom

o:206.title: ThePit
o:206.author: phoondos
o:206.description:
This is The Pit. It is a Pit. You can use the Pit for whatever you want.


All textures are CC0 and the geometry was hand-modeled by me (Wow that is SO Impressive I made a hole in the ground SO Impressive)

The fake skybox shader is made by Maranara (Thank you SO MUCH It works very well)

 

This is just the simplest map I could put out for BONELAB, but I do want to finish up my parkour map. It's going to take some time since the SDK is actively being developed and isn't finished, so that may take some time.

o:234.title: Broly Legendary
o:234.author: Meat
o:234.description:
The DBFZ Dbs Broly models! 

Includes base form and legendary Saiyan form

legendary Saiyan form comes with voice lines that I plan to add to base form as well 

 

To install:

Unzip the archive into your Bonelab Mods folder:

  • PC: C:\Users\[username]\AppData\LocalLow\Stress Level Zero\BONELAB\MODS
  • If installing locally to Quest 2, connect the headset with a Link cable, Allow Files from the connected device when prompted in the headset, then on the PC, navigate to:
    This PC\Quest 2\Internal shared storage\Android\data\com.StressLevelZero.BONELAB\files\Mods

o:264.title: MinMaximus the Big Bone Boss
o:264.author: TheGoldenDragon
o:264.description:
You have bigger arms and an even bigger body. The only real avatar that has some sort of advantage over the Big Bone Boss is the fast one, as it was hard to get a good balance between speed and strength.

It should work on quest 2 though idk as I have been playing pcvr. I will probably come back and update this when i actually test the quest 2 version, as i still need to get to the lab.

How to download:

If your on pc download the windows version and quest you download the android version. Download it on your pc. Unzip it

Then, if your on pc, drop the file in "C:\Users\[username]\AppData\LocalLow\Stress Level Zero\BONELAB\MODS"

If your on quest 2, you are gonna want to plug in your quest 2 to your pc. Then what you wanna do is go to "This PC\Quest 2\Internal shared storage\Android\data\com.StressLevelZero.BONELAB\files\Mods" and drop the mod in there. I have not yet tested it on quest as while I own a quest, I have only played on pcvr using virtual desktop. I have not progressed far enough to get to the lab in quest.

I hope you enjoy being an unstoppable killing machine. I liked making this so let me know what the next avatar should be

o:272.title: Wario Ware Wario
o:272.author: Valcuda
o:272.description:
A very scuffed Wario avatar of Wario in his Wario Ware outfit. Model ripped from "Smash Bros Brawl". Has sounds from "Super Mario 64 DS".

The Marrow engine wasn't made for Wario, and this avatar makes that pretty clear. He's basically a worse "Heavy".

Looking down also makes it impossible to walk because Wario starts standing on his toes. The camera is also located inside his head, because it feels very off having it where his eyes really are.

 

I'll likely never update this unless the Marrow SDK is updated in a way that allows for me to improve it.

o:274.title: SARS_Pointman
o:274.author: JLM
o:274.description:
How to install it:

  • For PC: Download the 'Windows' version, extract the zip file, Put the folder in the bonelab mods folder.
    The default location of the mods folder is C:\Users\[username]\AppData\LocalLow\Stress Level Zero\BONELAB\MODS.

  • For Quest: Download the 'Android' version, extract the zip file.
    Connect your vr headset with a Link cable, Allow Files from the connected device when prompted in the headset,
    then on the PC, navigate to:This PC\Quest 2\Internal shared storage\Android\data\com.StressLevelZero.BONELAB\files\Modsand move the extracted folder here.

o:277.title: MGRAvatars
o:277.author: DKC
o:277.description:
I got this model from p3dm.ru !

This was the first Jetstream Sam avatar posted here.

The hands are janky but I am fixing it and I have a new version.

I'll be adding the voicelines for death and stuff like that in a bit.

I looked at the other guy's model just before editting this, and they didn't fix the beard on the model in unity. Here I have done that. Though he has voicelines so I like that lol.

SHOW ME A GOOD TIME, JACK!

IGNORE THE "HANDS FIXED" IN THE CHANGE LOG, THEY ARE BROKEN SOMEHOW EVEN THJOUGH I LITERALLY TESTED THEM! EVERYTHING ELSE WORKS THOUGH!

TRIWAVE PROTOGEN

 

A simple Triwave protogen port, all credit goes to the main creator for the model, textures and so on, I simply ported it over.

Also includes custom sounds (Pain and dying)

 

Model creator: https://twitter.com/triwavebz

 

Known issues:

- Legs aren't aligned with the ground all the time and clip slightly

- Hologram in main menu is oversized for some reason

- Model's pretty chonky

Installation:

Put the folder in:

C:\Users\NAME\AppData\LocalLow\Stress Level Zero\BONELAB\Mods

Android - ignore the Pack Pallet part, simply put the mod files in the Mods folder:

o:291.title: Refine
o:291.author: Electric
o:291.description:
Refine is a small level to get to grips with the new SDK and ensure the assets I've currently made look correct in-game. A bit of crowbar climbing.

Quality now, scale later. I've got a lot to make and more ambitious levels planned.

Know issues include menus acting weird for some reason, one of the end holoscreens blacking out sometimes.

o:294.title: ArthurFord
o:294.author: Bredd
o:294.description:
Adds Arthur Ford as a selectable avatar, sounds effects included.
PCVR ready, no Quest support yet.


Credit for the model goes to Bukachell.

INSTALLATION

Extract the .ZIP file, copy the folder within into your Bonelab Mods folder.

  • The PC default is C:\Users\[username]\AppData\LocalLow\Stress Level Zero\BONELAB\MODS

o:296.title: Kurisu Port
o:296.author: Valcuda
o:296.description:
Note: FersyVR made a much better Kurisu avatar, I'd highly recommend checking theirs out if you want a Kurisu avatar! https://mod.io/g/bonelab/m/makise-kurisu-fast

 

Kurisu Makise from Steins;Gate, ported from VRChat. Here's a link to the original avatar: https://vrcmods.com/item/666

You'd think porting from VRChat to BoneLab would be easy, and while it is, it's not as easy as you'd think, since the materials get messed up, you have to remove scripts from bones, and with this model, I had to add 2 extra bones to act as her toes (Tho they don't do anything, since I suck at weight painting).

The only issue I found with her is that her hair is in view, which is annoying to say the least. Unfortunatly, I couldn't move the view down for some reason, which is also annoying because it's above her eyes for some reason.

 

Note: I only have a Quest, so it's possible the PC version has issues I'm not aware of.

o:301.title: BoneWorksMenu
o:301.author: volx4
o:301.description:
Just the main menu of previous title: Boneworks.

I will make a quest file but BEWARE I don't own a test so expect heavy performance drops.

If you do try it out comment down below how well it worked

 

Physics objects work! however no physics objects are grabbable, the scene is though! 

 

Known Bugs:

Closet door is broken

Cups shatter from spawn

Physics objects aren't grabbable

You can't access the menu screen (you can never leave whoops)!

 

I've ported all scenes materials/meshes. but I need your help! Looking for skilled modders to finish porting the rest of the game as the SDK improves!

o:303.title: AmeliaWatsonAvatar

A Bonelab avatar of the Hololive EN VTuber Amelia Watson

Model made by 10zou

IMPORTANT

o:309.title: Cavan
o:309.author: KittyNomad
o:309.description:
THE BASE PROTOGEN MODEL WAS BASED ON THE NKD PROTOGEN BY NUKUDE! PLEASE SUPPORT THEM: https://twitter.com/Nukude

-----------------------------------------

This is a Protogen avatar for Bonelab- specifically, my personal protogen. They're above average height. I̶ ̶i̶n̶c̶l̶u̶d̶e̶d̶ ̶v̶o̶i̶c̶e̶ ̶l̶i̶n̶e̶s̶ ̶i̶n̶ ̶t̶h̶e̶ ̶b̶u̶i̶l̶d̶ ̶b̶u̶t̶ ̶t̶h̶e̶ ̶M̶a̶r̶r̶o̶w̶ ̶S̶D̶K̶ ̶m̶a̶y̶ ̶n̶o̶t̶ ̶s̶u̶p̶p̶o̶r̶t̶ ̶t̶h̶e̶m̶ ̶p̶r̶o̶p̶e̶r̶l̶y̶ ̶r̶i̶g̶h̶t̶ ̶n̶o̶w̶?̶ I checked and the voice clips CAN be heard in-game!

(NOTE: Download comes with Quest and PC builds of the mod.)

Issues:

There's some weirdness with the fingers/toes, especially the thumbs. This is because I had to manually add new bones in Blender to make the model work at all in the game- (and I'm not very good at rigging lol)

The preview of the avatar is sometimes absolutely massive. No idea why, but the avatar itself seems to function fine.

I want to add the character as an NPC but unfortunately Marrow does not support custom NPCs currently, so I'll have to wait on that.

If you need to get in contact, message my discord account @cammy#3991.

o:323.title: Shipment
o:323.author: phoondos
o:323.description:
This is Shipment from Call of Duty 4: Modern Warfare's multiplayer mode.

That being said, I own NOTHING here.

Models and textures are property of Infinity Ward and Blizzard-Activision, and the ambient sounds are both owned by Facepunch Studios.

 

This is a map I wanted to port to BONEWORKS but never really followed through with doing it because I wanted to do the MW2019 version (don't even ask me about doing that, it's just not going to be possible). Please let me know if the audio levels are too much for the ambient tracks because I haven't tested the map with those tracks yet. In the SDK's future, I think I might make this an Arena or Zombie Warehouse-type map.

o:329.title: Mamagen Avatars
o:329.author: Kenz
o:329.description:
VRChat's favorite furry mommy, now in Bonelab!

Eight different variants of Ghostly's Mamagen avatar. Four armored, four unarmored.

Issues: No voice lines or soft body physics yet. They're a bit huge, but I think it's better that way.

This pack contains:

Mamagen (Grey)
Mamagen (Grey Armored)

Mamagen (Mocha)
Mamagen (Mocha Armored)

Mamagen (Redwood)
Mamagen (Redwood Armored)

Mamagen (Silver)
Mamagen (Silver Armored)

Stats: 

Height: 242cm 7ft11in
Mass: 108.24kg
Agility: 0.90Ns
Strength Upper: 1.80
Strength Lower: 2.82
Vitality: 1.90
Intelligence: 1.25

Pop on some fancy gear and enjoy your stay here at Birdy World! Play Basketball with your friends, and more! go check out the game! https://www.oculus.com/experiences/quest/4942916185821920

o:381.title: Deku
o:381.author: Ryker
o:381.description:
This mod works on both PC and Quest 2!

# Installation for PC

0. UNZIP or take the folder OUT OF THE ZIP

1. Copy folder named xxxx.xxxx (x should be the name)

2. WINDOWS + R

3. Type Appdata and click enter

4. LocalLow > Stress Level Zero > BONELAB > Mods

5. Paste xxxx.xxxx into mods folder

 

# Installation for QUEST

0. UNZIP or take the folder OUT OF THE ZIP

1. connect the headset with a Link cable

2. Allow Files from the connected device when prompted in the headset

3. then on the PC, navigate to: This PC\Quest 2\Internal shared storage\Android\data\com.StressLevelZero.BONELAB\files\Mods

4. copy the folder to it

o:403.title: Spartan Soldier
o:403.author: MMMiracles
o:403.description:
Stands at just over 7ft tall with almost double the strength and vitality of the vanilla 'Strong' avatar, this Spartan is here to show you that Master Chief isn't the only capable soldier out there.


Includes:

  • Custom Running/Walking sounds
  • Pain/hit sounds from Halo 3
  • The dying phase is marked by the sound of your energy shields depleting, get a kill to recover from it and you'll hear your shields recharge!
  • Chunky landing sounds from long falls!
  • Mostly non-jank hand rigs (they were a lot worse when I first got a hold of the model, trust me)


Model ripped from a Garrys Mod add-on pack, which seemingly didn't have much of a source for the model either.

Thanks to Pan17 for showing me where SLZ hid the audio variance data so I could actually add sounds to this!

o:406.title: MetroCop
o:406.author: VoidwayProductions
o:406.description: Metro cop from HLA. The hands are much more jank than the Gordon upload but I think it has to do with the mesh on the hands. Either way, now you can enjoy being the one in control with this metro cop avatar.

o:416.title: MGSVFemSneaking
o:416.author: Zadrakos
o:416.description:
So yeah, this model is headless since I didn't have a proper waifu to slap on, plus that would've been a little bit of a headache, but it works pretty decently for me in gameplay.

 

I haven't tested this current iteration, so I'm not actually sure if the boob physics that I think I added worked or not since there's no documentation that I could find at a glance. I hope I set it up all correctly. I got to sleep anyway, so I'll fix it if it's broken in the morning (In like... 9 hours from upload).

 

Might try to build it for Quest at some point, not entirely sure how to, but if people want it then sure, I will.

o:431.title: TF2_2FORT
o:431.author: JLM
o:431.description:
How to install it:

  • For PC: Download the 'Windows' version, extract the zip file, Put the folder in the bonelab mods folder.
    The default location of the mods folder is C:\Users\[username]\AppData\LocalLow\Stress Level Zero\BONELAB\MODS.

  • For Quest: Download the 'Android' version, extract the zip file.
    Connect your vr headset with a Link cable, Allow Files from the connected device when prompted in the headset,
    then on the PC, navigate to:This PC\Quest 2\Internal shared storage\Android\data\com.StressLevelZero.BONELAB\files\Modsand move the extracted folder here.

 

Notice:

This is a WIP, right now I have a version for PCVR, with static meshes and the full level. Still planning on a refinement with dynamic objects, lighting, and better texture shaders.

If you see any missing textures or experience any issue let me know on here or DM me on discord @ JeyLists#6552
